AER.caption: Image file (see docs)
AER.doc: The image itself. Accepts ".jpg" and ".png" formats only. If you already uploaded or referenced this image in a previous step in this workflow, just type its name in the first field to reuse it, no need to upload again. Protip: Reusing the same image will not increase your pdf file size! So reuse without limits :D
AER.name: image_link

AES.caption: Image name
AES.doc: You must provide a name for the image, because it will be its reference. Next time you use this same image, only type its name, no need to input an image below.
AES.name: image_name

AEd.caption: Is this element being put into a Multi Column?
AEd.doc: Mark this box if this element is between the Start and End of a multi column element.
AEd.name: into_multi_column

AEf.caption: Multi Column Name
AEf.doc: The name of the multi column you're wrapping this element within.
AEf.name: multi_column_name

AEj.caption: Image width
AEj.doc: You can leave these empty, then it will use the image's original size. Specify only width and the image will scale proportionaly, specify both width and height and the image will distort to fit.
AEj.name: image_width

AEk.caption: Image height
AEk.doc: You can leave these empty, then it will use the image's original size. Specify only width and the image will scale proportionaly, specify both width and height and the image will distort to fit.
AEk.name: image_height

AFE.caption: Below you will be able to set extra margins for your image element. Leave the box unchecked for a default display. (Will ignore any numbers below)
AFE.name: margin_info

AFc.caption: Is this element being put into the footer?
AFc.doc: Mark this box if this element is to be inserted into the footer.
AFc.name: into_footer

AFd.caption: Is this element being put into the header?
AFd.doc: Mark this box if this element is to be inserted into the header.
AFd.name: into_header
